column3: the loss of the [[The One Ring|Ring]] and his tortures in the land of [[Mordor]] had destroyed his mind. By the time he met [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]] and [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]] beneath the [[Emyn Muil]]
column4: his personality had split into two
column5: with one side seeking companionship and favour
column6: and the other side desperately wanting to recover the Ring at any cost
column7: including the murder of his companions. Sam secretly gave names to these two sides of Sméagol: the pathetic
column10: dangerous side he gave an even worse name: '''Stinker'''. As Gollum's darker side took him over completely
column11: so Sam started to use the name 'Stinker' as just another name for the scheming creature.<ref>{{TT|IV3}}</ref>
